Package com.aestus.api.attachment.service.impl

Class AttachmentServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
com.aestus.api.attachment.service.impl.AttachmentServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
AttachmentService
@Service public class AttachmentServiceImpl extends Object implements AttachmentService
The implementation of the Attachment service. This implementation uses a CrudRepository for persistence to a RDBMS via Hibernate.

    • createAttachment

      public Attachment createAttachment(org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file, String fileDesc, String documentType, int documentId) throws IOException
      If user uploads a file >16MB (mediumblob), MySql will throw a data truncation exception, stating that the data too long for column 'data'. This is a MySql specific exception ( com.mysql.cj.jdbc.exceptions.MysqlDataTruncation). At this stage of development, so as not to bind the persistence tier to any RDBMS, this exception is allowed to propagate up the stack and caught as a Hibernate DataException.

      In deployment, when the RDBMS is decided, we can consider catching a DB specific exception and providing a more meaningful error message to the controller.

      Specified by:
      createAttachment in interface AttachmentService
      Parameters:
      file - the file
      fileDesc - the description of the file
      documentType - the type of document the file is attached to
      documentId - the id of document the file is attached to
      Returns:
      the attachment
      Throws:
      IOException - the io exception
